answers.author: Ramesh Kanapareddy
answers.text:
At Highland Park, IL on an annual basis, the CIP funding levels are adjusted by an inflation factor to ensure adequacy of infrastructure funding levels are maintained with current economic trends. The current FY 14 budget year's 5-yr CIP plan, 2014-2018 CIP, inflation factor is based on the 2010-2012 American City and County Construction cost index trend line.  The annual 5-yr CIP budget reflects a change in the inflation factor established in the Financial and Budgetary Policies using a three-year rolling average of the American City and County Construction Cost Index in lieu of the index published by the Engineering News Record. The recommended index is targeted toward the local government level, derived from asphalt, concrete and other prices more suited for projects performed at a local municipal level.

author: Steven Downs
text: What methods do other communities use to forecast inflation for the cost of future projects in their Capital Improvement Program?  Currently Mesa uses CPI, but I am wondering if other communities are using construction-specific indexes or other methods.
title: CIP - Inflation Rates
